result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ellen Joan Barron was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ellen Joan Barron

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

3:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ellen Joan Barron in court.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp in court for Ellen Joan Barron. 
2022TR000136, 2022TR000137 tracking with 22CF15:
Atty Burdon states plea agreement to Count 1, OWI - 4th offense.  Count 2 to be dismissed along with 22TR136 & 22TR137.  Atty Klopp agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1, OWI - 4th offense and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. Count 2 to be dismissed along with 22TR136 & 22TR137.

Both counsel waives the PSI request
Atty Burdon makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Klopp makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1, OWI - 4th offense:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
45 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; conditional time
Report forthwith
Credit = 2 days (if revoked)
Electronic Monitoring
Good Time
Pay fine of $800 and costs = $2,046.00
Blood Draw Reimbursement = $50.00
30 month Drivers License Revocation
30 month Ignition Interlock (once reinstated)
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent 
BAC:  .186
Cash bond to be applied
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm. 

Remainder of Costs to be paid through Probation

Count 2 to be dismissed along with 22TR136 & 22TR137.

3:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ellen Joan Barron in court.  Attorney Roger L. Klopp in court for Ellen Joan Barron. 
2022TR000136, 2022TR000137 tracking with 22CF15:
Atty Klopp states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Burdon filed the information electronically with the Court. Court gives a copy to Atty Klopp.   Atty Klopp and the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.
Preliminary hearing on May 31, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:34 PM Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video means for Defendant Ellen Joan Barron. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared  by video means for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ellen Joan Barron appeared by video means.
22TR136 & 22TR137 tracking with 22CF15:
Atty Klopp states that the blood test has not been received yet.  Atty Juech agrees.  Atty Klopp asks for a prelim to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set prelim  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:05 AM Attorney Roger L. Klopp appeared by video means for Defendant Ellen Joan Barron. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ellen Joan Barron appeared by video means.
  Atty Klopp states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.
Atty Klopp waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:    Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
bond continued  Status hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 000361,
Payable Number: 73726,
Receipt Number: 22R 000538,
Amount: $20.00
Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  *Maintain Absolute Sobriety

03:18 PM Defendant Ellen Joan Barron appeared by video means from marquette county jail. Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and tried to call the Public Defender office.    Court finds probable cause for the charge for Riverside purposes.

Atty Juech requests some cash bail but will leave that amout up to the court.
Defendant responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions:
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety  Initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
